title: Jonah Hill spotted getting changed for surf lesson... after snapping up a $6.7M Santa Monica home
text:
He recently splashed out $6.77million for a Southern Colonial-style house in the seaside city of Santa Monica, California, with his fiancée Gianna Santos.

And Jonah Hill, 35, appeared to be making the most of his new locale over the weekend, when he was spotted changing out of his wetsuit following a surf lesson several miles up the coast in Malibu.

The Superbad star, who grew up in Los Angeles' wealthy Cheviot Hills, stood next to his truck as he switched from his green waterproof gear to a brown sweater and blue trousers – with a blanket protecting his modesty part of the way.

Day on the coast: Jonah Hill was spotted changing out of his wetsuit following a surf lesson in Malibu, California, over the weekend

Keeping things casual, the screen star threw on a pair of sliders before climbing into his vehicle and continuing with his day.

Jonah and former stylist Gianna, 30, have often been seen strolling around Santa Monica since moving into their palatial abode in the sun-kissed coastal city.

He purchased the 3,100 square-foot home from singer-songwriter Jesse Jo Stark, who had bought the property from Band-Aid heiress Libet Johnson in 2014.

Change clothes: The Superbad star stood next to his truck as he switched from his green waterproof gear to a brown sweater and blue trousers

The actor also owns an abode in New York City's NoHo neighbourhood that he snapped for $9.2 million in 2015.

Jonah and Gianna were first spotted together when they enjoyed a stroll in New York City in August 2018, and reportedly started dating around the same time.

News of their engagement came to light in September of this year, although it's not known when the star popped the big question or when they plan to tie the knot.

On the work front, it was recently reported that Jonah pulled out of talks to star as either the Penguin or the Riddler in The Batman movie.

Going green: The 21 Jump Street actor, 35, donned an olive green wetsuit for his surf lesson

The 21 Jump Street star passed on the film after failing to agree a deal with Warner Bros., according to Variety.

It's not clear how his withdrawal might affect the progress of The Batman, which had been expected to begin production either at the end of this year or early in 2020.

Zoe Kravitz was recently confirmed to star as Catwoman opposite Robert Pattinson's Caped Crusader.

Geoffrey Wright is also on board to play Commissioner Gordon in the latest Gotham story to hit the big screen, set to be written and directed by Matt Reeves.

Ben Affleck stepped down as both director and star after two outings as the Dark Knight in 2016's Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice and 2017's Justice League.
